articles.title: Watkins double fires Aston Villa to stunning win at Chelsea
articles.summary: Substitute Ollie Watkins fires a second-half double as Aston Villa fight back from a goal down to beat Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.

articles.title: Arsenal return to top of table with win over Brighton
articles.summary: Arsenal return to the top of the table with Martin Odegaard scoring his first Premier League goal of the season to beat Brighton 2-1.

articles.title: Cherki stars in late Manchester City win against Nottingham Forest
articles.summary: Rayan Cherki assists in the first half and scores late in the second for Manchester City to beat Nottingham Forest 2-1 and get their sixth Premier League win in a row.

articles.title: Wirtz scores first Liverpool goal in victory against Wolves
articles.summary: Liverpool score twice within a minute as Florian Wirtz scores his first goal for his side to beat Wolverhampton Wanderers 2-1.

articles.title: Burnley hold Everton to goalless draw
articles.summary: Burnley keep a clean sheet but still remain four points from safety in the Premier League table after a 0-0 draw with Everton.

articles.title: 'He just needed more time' - Wirtz finally breaks Liverpool duck
articles.summary: Florian Wirtz finally scores his first goal for Liverpool in Saturday's win over Wolves - and shows he adapting to "the hardest league in the world".

articles.title: Arsenal in 'survival' mode as 'sensational' Raya save keeps them top
articles.summary: David Raya's "sensational" second-half save keeps Arsenal top of the Premier League - with the Gunners in "survival" mode.

articles.title: 'Such an easy game to ref' - Dyche 'stunned' by 'bizarre' VAR calls
articles.summary: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche is critical of the officials over some "bizarre" decisions in his side's late 2-1 defeat by Manchester City.

articles.title: 'We're not Barcelona' - but McInnes knows how Hearts can respond
articles.summary: Derek McInnes knows his Hearts side are not Barcelona, but he knows what his team need to be if they are to sustain a Scottish Premiership title challenge.

articles.title: Wirtz showing glimpses of a top, top player - Rooney
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Wayne Rooney praises the performance and development of Florian Wirtz after he scored his first Premier League goal for Liverpool in their 2-1 win over Wolves.

articles.title: Emery's triple change fires Villa to victory at Chelsea
articles.summary: Match of the Day's Wayne Rooney analyses why Unai Emery's second-half substitutions were so impactful as Aston Villa came from a goal down to beat Chelsea 2-1 at Stamford Bridge.

articles.title: Villa will not speak about league target until game 34 - Emery
articles.summary: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery insists it is still too early to say whether his side is in contention for the Premier League title despite being third in the table after their 2-1 victory against Chel...

articles.title: How releasing Reijnders gave Man City win at Forest
articles.summary: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer analyses the half-time tactical tweak from Manchester City which released Tijani Reijnders into attacking areas and gave City a vital 2-1 win at Nottingham Forest.

articles.title: Equaliser changed dynamic of game - Maresca
articles.summary: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says that his side dominated the game in the first hour but were unable to respond to the shift in dynamics after they conceded the first goal to Aston Villa.

articles.title: Arsenal should have won by more - Arteta
articles.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta say his team's next step is to capitalise on their chances more and create bigger scorelines after a 2-1 win against Brighton.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: 'I can only get better' - Littler sends warning to rivals
articles.summary: Luke Littler says he "can only get better" after a "statement" victory in the third round of the World Darts Championship.

articles.title: Littler thrashes Suljovic with statement win as Bunting dumped out
articles.summary: Luke Littler thrashed Mensur Suljovic with a statement 4-0 win in the third round as Stephen Bunting was knocked out of the World Darts Championship by James Hurrell.

articles.title: Littler puts on dominant display to see off Suljovic
articles.summary: Highlights of the third round match between Luke Littler and Mensur Suljovic at the World Darts Championships.

articles.title: 'Blown the Bullet away!' | Hurrell dumps out fourth seed Bunting!
articles.summary: James Hurrell beats Stephen Bunting to make the last 16 of the World Darts Championships.

articles.title: World Darts Championship: Littler boasts of planning for final after statement win

articles.title: Rohl wants more from Rangers midfielder Raskin
articles.summary: Rangers manager Danny Rohl wants more from midfielder Nicolas Raskin and has had a long conversation with the Belgium international about the required improvements.

articles.title: 'Respect the culture' - Fifa urged to allow Pride Match
articles.summary: An official involved with the World Cup Pride Match says there has been no contact from Fifa about their plans, despite the Egyptian FA's complaint.
